{{cpp/keyword/title|{{tt|class}}}}
{{cpp/keyword/navbar}}

===Usage===
* [[cpp/language/class|declaration of a class]]
{{rrev|since=c++11|
* [[cpp/language/enum|declaration of a scoped enumeration type]]
}}
* In a [[cpp/language/templates | template declaration]], {{c|class}} can be used to introduce [[cpp/language/template_parameters#Type_template_parameter | type template parameters]] and [[cpp/language/template_parameters#Template_template_parameter | template template parameters]]
* If a function or a variable exists in scope with the name identical to the name of a class type, {{tt|class}} can be prepended to the name for disambiguation, resulting in an [[cpp/language/elaborated type specifier|elaborated type specifier]]

===Example===
{{example|code=
class Foo; // forward declaration of a class

class Bar  // definition of a class
{
public:
    Bar(int i) : m_i(i) {}
private:
    int m_i;
};

template&lt;class T&gt; // template argument
void qux()
{
    T t;
}

enum class Pub // scoped enum, since C++11
{
    b, d, p, q
};

int main()
{
    Bar Bar(1); // variable Bar hides type Bar
    Bar Bar2(2); // compiler error
    class Bar Bar3(3); // elaborated type
}
}}
